page.title: 11The Church in Halewood.
page.content: The main religious denominations to be found in Halewood are the Church of England, the Methodists and the Roman Catholic Church. St Nicholas Church of England built in the village of Halewood in 1839 still mainly serves the northern part of Halewood. St Mary's Church, a joint Methodist Anglican venture, was built in 1967 and was rebuilt in 1974 following a bad fire. This church tends to serve the newer area of Halewood to the south of the railway. There are three Catholic churches within a reasonable distance but only one within our area. This is St Mark's Church and is a reasonably new church built to cater for the people living in the southern part of Halewood.
